settings.blog-title: WHAT TO PACK FOR A WEEKEND AWAY

settings.text: Whether it’s a long weekend in the Cotswolds or a staycation in the Lake District, the idea of time away from our daily routines is sure to evoke excitement and joy. The packing part? Not so much. While you may be raring to get on your way, packing smartly and appropriately can save you a great deal of stress once you’re there. Follow Chinti & Parker’s seven foolproof tips on packing for a weekend away.

settings.grid-content:
1. Outfits to pack for your weekend away

Consider how you will be spending your weekend away clothes accordingly. Your outfits should transition from day to night for easy planning between activities.

Although the British weather is infamously unpredictable, look ahead for the forecast and use this in your outfit considerations. Layers are always a good idea.

Don’t forget to pack those special pieces that you can wear out, if your getaway calls for them.

2. Essential vacation shoes

Shoes are the bane of easy packing. They’re bulky and unsuitably shaped, making them tricky to pop in a weekend bag. Stick with the shoes you’re going to need most - a pair of trainers or boots for exploring, heels for nights out, etc. - and plan your outfits around these. Picking a pair to travel in and another pair to pack may be your most efficient option when it comes to vacation shoes.

Once you’ve chosen your footwear, stuff it with underwear, socks, chargers and small beauty products. You can save on space and stop your shoes losing their shape amidst the crush.

3. What not to bring on your weekend away

Jeans, jackets, and other bulky items can take up a lot of space in your luggage and can weigh your bag down. Opt for variety, such as skirts, floaty dresses, trousers or track pants, depending on the weather ahead and your agenda. Play it safe and pack a few classic fashion pieces to provide more possible combinations.

If you are taking two or more pairs of jeans, try to wear one as you travel to cut down on bulk.

4. How to organise your weekend bag

If you’re a person who thrives on organisation, you may already be familiar with this approach. Long weekend trips and staycations can often feel panicked or rushed, especially if you struggle to find certain key items in the depths of your suitcase.

The perfectly packaged bag will allow you to make the most of your time away. Try organising similar items into smaller bags or compartments - technology and chargers, jewellery, socks and underwear, T-shirts, etc. - to easily locate what you need in a hurry. Our reusable Chinti & Parker drawstring canvas bags will come in useful here.

5. How to pack efficiently

After sorting your clothes into smaller compartments, it’s time to pack efficiently. A tried-and-tested method for optimising storage and reducing wrinkles is rolling your clothes rather than folding them. Apply this technique to garments such as knitwear cotton T-shirts and trousers. This prevents wrinkles that may be difficult to remove when you’re away from home, and frees up room.

The exceptions to this are stiff fabrics which are better folded. Fragile or embellished garments should travel in their own garment bags, be laid flat during travel, and hung as soon as you get to your destination. If you’re staying for more than one night, take the time to unpack all your clothes upon arrival.

6. Have a bag for worn items

Don’t forget about your return journey. Carry a spare tote that can be used to store your worn items throughout your trip. That way, when you get home, these can simply be transferred to your washing machine for laundering. It also keeps soiled items well away from clean ones, preventing any stain transfer mishaps.

7. Beauty products to bring on holiday

Depending on where you are staying, some accommodation may provide toiletries, but you don’t want to assume. They may also not be suited to your skin and hair types, particularly if you follow a strict routine. Take your tried and true products, decanted into smaller travel-sized containers if you’re light on space. Keep up with your skincare whilst travelling for the ultimate holiday glow.
